pageContext.claim: “You had a very low GDP. It was 1.2%, 1.2%. It was going down. It was going to be a negative. Last quarter, we just hit, as you all know, 4.1%.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. Quarterly GDP growth topped 3 percent often in Barack Obama's presidency, mostly recently 2015. Trump has pledged 4 percent annual growth, which most economists think is unlikely. He is referring to quarterly growth in this remark, which is a different measure.
